alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 7:28PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bradford, northeastern Alachua, south central Union and southwestern Clay Counties through 800 PM EST... At 728 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New River, or near Lake Butler, moving east southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Starke, Keystone Heights, Kingsley, Beasley, New River, Lake Geneva, Sampson, Waldo, Hampton and Brooker. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Union; Western Clay
